title: Databases
description: Test your knowledge of database concepts, models, normalization, SQL commands, indexing, and transactions

questions.question: What is a database?

answers.b: An organized collection of related data

questions.question: What is the primary role of a Database Management System (DBMS)?

answers.b: Managing and accessing data in the database

questions.question: Which database model uses tables with rows and columns?
What is a row in a relational table called?
What is a column in a relational table called?
What does a primary key represent?

answers.a: An attribute that can have NULL values
answers.b: An attribute that uniquely identifies each row

questions.question: What is the purpose of a foreign key?
What is a relation in the relational model?
What does an attribute domain define?

answers.b: The set of allowed attribute values
answers.d: The number of rows in a table

questions.question: Which normal form removes partial dependencies?
Which normal form removes transitive dependencies?
What is the goal of database normalization?

answers.a: Increasing the number of tables without reason

questions.question: Which SQL command is used to retrieve data?
Which SQL command is used to insert new records?
Which SQL command is used to modify existing data?
What is an index in a database?

answers.b: A mechanism to speed up searching

questions.question: What is the main disadvantage of an index?

answers.b: It increases storage usage and write time
answers.d: It cannot be used with keys

questions.question: What is a transaction in a database?

answers.b: A set of SQL commands executed as a whole

questions.question: Which transaction property ensures that all changes are executed or none are?
Which ACID property ensures that data remains stored after a transaction is committed?
